ca.mcgill.ecse211.controller

Class RobotController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.controller.RobotController

  • public class RobotController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class controls the low-level operations of the robot's motors. These operations include turning the robot, moving it forward, stopping it, and traveling to a waypoint. The RobotController is used by any class that needs to do any of the operations described above. This class is used by all middle layer (navigation) classes, since they all involve the movement of the robot.
    Author:
    Bijan Sadeghi

    • Constructor Detail

      • RobotController

        public RobotController(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                       EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                       double WHEEL_RAD,
                       double TRACK,
                       int FORWARD_SPEED,
                       int ROTATE_SPEED,
                       int ACCELERATION,
                       double TILE_SIZE,
                       double SENSOR_DIST)
        Parameters:
        leftMotor - the left motor
        rightMotor - the right motor
        WHEEL_RAD - the radius of the wheel
        TRACK - the track of the robot
        FORWARD_SPEED - the speed to travel forward at
        ROTATE_SPEED - the speed to rotate at
        ACCELERATION - the acceleration to use
        TILE_SIZE - the size of a tile
        SENSOR_DIST - the vertical offset of the rear sensors from the robot's center

        public int convertDistance(double radius,
                           double distance)
        Parameters:
        radius - the radius of the wheel
        distance - the desired distance to move the robot
        Returns:
        the angle the robot needs to rotate its wheels by in order to travel forward by distance

                        double width,
                        double angle)
        Parameters:

        width - the track of the robot
        angle - the angle desired to turn the robot by
        Returns:
        the angle the robot needs to turn each wheel to rotate by angle.

      • directTravelTo

        public void directTravelTo(double x,
                           double y,
                           int speed,
                           boolean lock)
        Travels to (x, y) with speed "speed" and an optional lock for the motors.
        Parameters:
        x - the x destination of the robot
        y - the y destination of the robot
        speed - the speed to move the robot at
        lock - an optional lock on the motors

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(int x,
                     int y,
                     int speed,
                     boolean lock)
        Travels to (x, y) stricly on the x-axis and y-axis using odometry correction. If one of x or y is the same as the robot's current x or y, then the robot will travel directly either horizontally or vertically. If both x and y differ from the robot's, then the robot will travel in an L-shape, starting on the x-axis first.
        Parameters:
        x - the x destination of the robot
        y - the y destination of the robot
        speed - the speed to move the robot at
        lock - an optional lock on the motors

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double absTheta)
        Turns the robot to the specified absolute angle.
        Parameters:
        absTheta - the absolute angle to turn the robot to

      • turnBy

        Parameters:
